definition: see 莎草[suo1 cao3]/see 摩莎[mo2 suo1]

sentences.english: The family has bought some furniture — a wardrobe — and new saris and jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 這個家庭已經購買了一些傢俱，還有新的莎麗和珠寶。

sentences.english: Sally agreed to be my date tonight.
sentences.chinese: 莎麗同意今晚跟我出赴約會。

sentences.english: The Miss Sullivans will return to New York.
sentences.chinese: 莎麗文家的女士們將回紐約去。

sentences.english: I will bring enough cash to give Shanghai Shari this time.
sentences.chinese: 我會帶足夠的現金，讓上海莎麗這一次。

sentences.english: Looking up, Lisa could see her pain reflected in the man's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 擡起頭，莎麗能夠看到這個男人眼中呈現的同樣傷痛。

sentences.english: As Sally repeatedly told me, she is a star.
sentences.chinese: 正如莎麗對我一再強調的，她是一個明星。

sentences.english: Through Sally I asked Ellen if she thought she'd make it to 111.
sentences.chinese: 通過莎麗我問埃倫是否想過要活到111歲。

sentences.english: "The second is a cherry without any stone, " replied Sally.
sentences.chinese: “第二件禮物是沒有核的櫻桃，”莎麗回答。

sentences.english: It was half past ten. Sarie watched the path anxiously.
sentences.chinese: 十點半鐘的時候，莎麗焦急地朝着小路張望。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
